newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Acoje, Itogon share prices frozen.
newsitem.headline: Acoje, Itogon share prices frozen.

text.p: The Philippine Stock Exchange (PSE) froze on Monday for the third straight session a rise in the share prices of Acoje Holdings Inc and Itogon-Suyoc Mines Inc.
The PSE surveillance department said Acoje share price was frozen in early trade at 54 centavos, a 50 percent rise from Friday's close of 36 centavos.
Acoje was a mining company that was recently converted into a holding company.
The bourse also halted any further rise in mining firm Itogon-Suyoc A shares after they reached 13.50 centavos, a 45.9 percent gain from 9.25 centavos in the previous session.
The bourse did not intervene in Itogon B shares, which were still below the 50 percent mark.
The PSE automatically freezes shares when they rise by close to 50 percent on a single day.
The PSE surveillance department said the two companies have yet to submit explanations regarding the share price rises.
An Itogon official who asked not to be named said the company is preparing a response to the bourse's query. He said the firm did not know why its shares surged.
Acoje has denied rumours of a foreign firm buying into the company, which traders said was the reason for the stock's rise.

After the bourse capped a further rise in its share price, Acoje was trading at 46 centavos, up 10 centavos or 27.78 percent from the previous close. Itogon A shares were up 2.25 centavos, or 24.32 percent, at 11.50 centavos, with volume reaching a modest 123,800.
